message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.NE, cs.IR. 

The paper deals with a natural language processing (NLP) problem of splitting and rephrasing complex sentences, which is a common topic in the cs.CL (Computation and Language) sub-category. The use of neural models and copy-mechanism suggests that it could also fit into the cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.LG (Machine Learning) sub-categories. Additionally, the paper discusses the use of BLEU scores, which is a common evaluation metric in the cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) sub-category. Finally, the paper deals with text data and language models, which could also fit into the cs.IR (Information Retrieval) sub-category.
